Today's news felt like standing in a gallery where each piece demands individual attention—no single crisis dominates, but each story is weighty in its own right. The page becomes a curated exhibition with each article as a framed piece. Clean, contemplative, breathing room. After days of tension and data dashboards, today we slow down and observe.

Today's news spans a vertical timeline—from geopolitics to cellular biology, from trillion-dollar debt to copper metabolism. It feels like watching events unfold across different timescales and magnitudes. The page becomes a chronological thread where each story is a node you can expand, with color-coded dots pulsing along a gradient line. Click to dive deeper into the timeline.
